Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: 252funinthesun
Reviews.Content: we were looking for a small place we could set our bags and enjoy the island. The hotel is small in comparison to the Ritz and Hampton nearby, but for 100 dollars less than what they charge it was perfectly fine by me. Liz and Herman were very nice and welcoming always asking about our adventure for the day and making sure we were being taken care of each time they saw us. I won't lie, the hotel is dated, but our room was very clean and there was nothing wrong with our lock- I slept just fine. I know there are some people who want all the bells and whistles out of a hotel but if you want to save money while staying in a popular area-this is definetly the place to go. I would say it's a hotel with a bed-and-breakfast atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Scary hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarylandSpartan
Reviews.Content: The door was chipped right next to the door knob as if someone had tried to break in, the elevator was in very poor shape and did not accommodate more than 3 people at a time, bugs in the room, etc. We wedged a chair under the door knob as we tried to sleep that night. Thank goodness it was only one night! I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as you'd think”
Reviews.Author: Keely F
Reviews.Content: When you first walk in you think "what did I get myself into?" The lobby, elevator, hallways and stairwell are in definite need of repair and updating but the room itself was clean. I was pleasantly surprised by the room and the restaurant attached to the hotel. It isn't a hotel you'd want to hang out in but to sleep it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “This place was just "o.k."”
Reviews.Author: JZebo
Reviews.Content: Our room was all right but not the best. It seemed clean enough but the shower leaked terribly and the water was all over the floor. The sheet on the bed must have been for a twin size because it did not even cover the mattress. It was near the beach and casinos so there was a lot going on, however, I would try to find someplace else. Very close to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Just have your expectations set correctly...”
Reviews.Author: BIP_TK
Reviews.Content: This place often shows up as one of the cheaper hotels in Isla Verde. Its not great, but its not horrible either. The internet didn't work in the room when we were there, and the place is a little dingy, but we booked last minute and were happy to be near the beach and parking was easy and free. They have a little restaurant in front that's solid and if you're saving money, you'll survie here....

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I ever stayed in.....and I travel a lot...”
Reviews.Author: bella134
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel by mistake, we were in Old San Juan and all hotels there were booked, so a friendly hotel receptionist offered to help. I told him if he could call and reserve a room at Coral Princess Hotel in Condado which I remembered from their website was a very nice botique size hotel at $95 a night so this poor receptinist made a reservatin by mistake at Coral by the Sea.Although the same price I was just dumbfouded of how infected and disgusting this hotel was. I stayed inmany hostels around the world but this one wouldn't even qualify for a free stay.....It was $98 per night and I think it was $98 too many....I didn't share to shower and slept dressed with the clothes I wore the day before. The curtains were soiled with dirt, the fake ceiling was ripped, the bed linens were terrible and the room was the worst I ever been into....The irony was that the hotel was booked, so I tried to figure out he mistery. Apparently the majority of tourist in San Juan are in transit to their cruises. They stay for a night or two and they are not returning, therefore the quality of service is not important..... If you are planning to go to San Juan, please make yourself a service and book a room in advance, there are beautiful small hotels in Old San Juan, we walked to all of them, unfortunately were sold out, it cost about the same $80 - $150 and they look wonderful> A fewhotles we loved were: Hotel Casablanca, Da Haus Hotel, or Coral Princess in Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Safe Location Only 2 Blocks Walk to Beach”
Reviews.Author: Robert_DMello
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couples days before our cruise. It is a safe place a lot of police visible on the streets. A lot of places in walking distance to choose from to eat. There is a Walgreens next door for personal items, beach items and a really nice cafe style shop in the hotel that serves a varity of food and great ice cream. I think the beach was only a couple of blocks away. So no need to rent a car or take a taxi to get to the beach. The beach is very nice. The room was clean, and the neighborhood safe. The elevator door looked like it seen better days, but it does not effect your stay there. The staff were pleasant to talk to. The bathroom could be updated, but we were out most of the time there so didn't spend much time in there.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tammy M
Reviews.Content: Don't even bother with this hotel! For the asking price, I am more than sure you can get a better hotel nearby. During my one night stay, I slept with the lights on. It smells, it's dirty, the hotel staff is horrendously rude, and there's no one to help you with heavy luggage. FYI, there are stairs in front of the entrance, so be mindful if you have heavy luggage (you WILL have to carry it yourself). The doors to the rooms are so old, you have to slam them to get them shut and you have to carry around a key with a big keychain that has your room number on it (not the keycards newer hotels have). The elevator is so old, you almost expect it to breakdown everytime you step inside. It's a mess!! I slept on top of the bed cover with my own blanket because I was too disgusted to even try and sleep on those sheets. I am not a picky person but this was by far my most horrific experience at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff Diane's great, rooms nice, awesome shower visited twice and loved the restaurants down stairs.”
Reviews.Author: bruce_logemann
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stays there. Thanks The hotel has friendly and helpful staff Diane's great, rooms nice, awesome shower visited twice and loved the restaurants down stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Not My Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Drew S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a one-night layover on a flight to the BVI. The rooms are cheaper than some of the other hotels in the area, and it's right by the airport. The pictures depict an older building, so my expectations were not all that high. Previous reviewers describe the property and rooms accurately - small, and in desparate need of an update. Breakfast, taken in the outside section, was very good and the restaurant, like a lot of San Juan that I saw, had a cool art-deco vibe. The front desk person that made my reservation the night before I arrived and the one that checked me in had cheery and helpful attitudes, but the other front desk agents were un-cooperative and somewhat surly, despite my attempts to be a good customer. One of them was at once surly to me, and then all nice, when she thought that it was time for a tip. She didn't get one, but the very nice man who checked me in earlier, did. In the morning, they refused to call the taxi driver that I had used the night before, but what really aggravated me was that the taxi that they did call (obviously a friend) overcharged me for the ride to the airport. Taxi rates to and from the airport and the hotel are published. When I asked why my fare was more, I got a lot of bs and outright lies, like, "It's an extra dollar for the call." What call? I stood my ground at the airport, and after placing two quarters on top of my bag (rather than handing them to me), she made a quick exit. My intention was to straighten things out at the airport taxi stand, but she didn't like that idea at all. It was fairly obvious criminal behavior. This may sound more like a review of a taxi driver, rather than that of the hotel, but the hotel staff called this taxi specifically. My message to the owners/managers of this property, if you ever bother to read this website: The Coral Sea is what it is, but shabby treatment of your customers doesn't help, at all. Allowing your employees to take advantage of your customers and engage in criminal behavior will drive your customers away. I don't think that things will change at this hotel, but at least we can read all about it on TripAdvisor, no?

Reviews.Title: “Price / Quality GOOD”
Reviews.Author: kevsuperh0t
Reviews.Content: I have stay in the hotel for two night, the staff are very friendly and helpful, the room are OK, flat screen tv, good A.C, confortable bed, clean. At the price I have pay I will say that this hotel is excellent, this is not the Ritz of course but I have stay in the Ritz one year ago ans it cost me around 600$/night, I had very appreciate the hotel but in comparaison I gave a better note fot the coral because it's not just an hotel,it's a price vs hotel. So what I mean is the price is very good for what you get. The restaurant is excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “So Awful.”
Reviews.Author: Natasha C
Reviews.Content: If I could, I would give this place a zero rating - it was THAT bad. My suspicions should have been raised when we arrived to see alot of men in labouring type clothes leaving the building - this is obviously where they are housed for cheap accomodation. It is digusting, stinky and awful. Please stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “OMG!!! That mess!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wislie
Reviews.Content: Never! But never stay here. The place looks like a horror movie. Initially my reservation was for 2 adults and 2 children and for personal reasons it was me and my boyfriend. I called before hand to ask for it to be a single bed room and the man confirmed that it was going to be so. When we arrived, the first thing that surprised us was the strong smell of damp or old! The guy in front desk tells us very happy that we got an upgrade to the suite because we were paying a double room and we were only two, HE SAID THE BEST ROOM THEY HAD. My God when we got to the elevator it amaze us much, but more fear gave us when we arrived at our SUITE 516! OMG that horrible room, was about to mourn, the smell was horrible, too small, the window with a thousand fingers marks, moldy lamps and the curtain did not close completely. We went to take a dessert at the restaurant Piu Bello (the best thing about the hotel in fact) to talk about if we would stay or leave and honestly we were about to pick up our things and go, I got a nauseas you have no idea. My boyfriend told me that we should stay because it was too late. We went to Walgreens to buy Febreeze to mask the uky smell in the room and to be able to spend the night. We could not sleep at all! For fear that some weird insect would climb into the bed. We pay $ 98 for a nightmare! You know what was the worst? The hay a large sign outside, that says Rooms Recently updated, seriously?? We will never come back, and we advised everyone do not stay for nothing!

Reviews.Title: “This place is bad!!!”
Reviews.Author: MissJ20
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights, and I must say that if i wasnt on the go every day, I would have slept on the park bench. The room wasnt cleaned, the shower was DIRTY and there was even mold on the shower curtains, and there is a not refridgerator or microwave anywhere. I personally would never stay there again

Reviews.Title: “we loved it”
Reviews.Author: luciah261
Reviews.Content: the late check in was great since my flight arrived at midnight the hotel has security guard all night long there is also a restaurant near the food was delicious and the people are very friendly

Reviews.Title: “What if....”
Reviews.Author: CrucianSweetness
Reviews.Content: Coral by the sea was able to accommodate my family,and I.After we was refused accommodation at the raddison.The staff was friendly,and the manager even added a fold up bed to the room.Please try Pui Bello gellato,and variety of delicious items.I liked to go to Pui Bello when a friendly,and very attentive manager Christopher never forgot to give me my discount,because I was staying at the hotel.Morning timesaving I had to pay full price for my coffee,and breakfast simply because the lady manager never took the time to acknowledge I was staying at the hotel.Other than that I want to give a big shout out to Coral by the Sea staff,and Christopher from hotel restaurant. THANKS GUYS. ...God Bless.....Don't forget to come santa cruz Christopher. ......

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!!”
Reviews.Author: stormmsk
Reviews.Content: These pictures must bve when the first built this place. We stayed there because had no air that night, omg we should have stayed without air. This place has bugs, smells, just unclean. So you get what you paid for and than some..

Reviews.Title: “horrible smelly unsafe filthy”
Reviews.Author: carrieon415
Reviews.Content: towels are dirty and see thru. doors do not close properly leaving you at risk for theft and harm. room was filthy and smelled horribly. thank GOD it was a 1 night stay this hotel should be taken out of business

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for a Reason”
Reviews.Author: trip9960763
Reviews.Content: The price was inexpensive but not worth the terrible experience. They didn't have any rooms available at the time of check in. The towels and beddig were dingy and hard The floor was ceramic floors. The staff was not very friendly. The hotel was not secure because someone knocked on my door in the middle of the night. When I called the front desk , they said they would send someone up to check but they never did. Pay a little more and find a different hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very poor services”
Reviews.Author: jahqueen
Reviews.Content: My experience that I had was very poor my sistren & I check in 11/10 we stayed 2 nite 3days the first nite we went casino & on the 2nd nite someone went in the room ramsack my cloths & stole $100.00 the front end never show no pity 4 us & never put us in a other room we had 2 put a chair by the door because we was scared when the police arrived their were VERY RUDE. When I ask 4 the manager their say we don't have 1 just a acting manger she was no help the next day. She never offer a credit or when you all come back the next time you will get a free stay not even that but the funny thin when we told the front end person about someone broke into our room she LAUGH my sistren & I HIGHLY NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL MY IS NADINE

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel eperience ever”
Reviews.Author: triniboy99
Reviews.Content: guest services at check in was rude and not customer service friendly.the elevator on the night of check in was filty and stunk with like beer scent on the floor,cable for tv kept cutting off,internet service was very slow and down for a whole night and overall the hotel was just terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Spartan”
Reviews.Author: 612dave
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for luxury, this isn't the right place for you. We stayed for 3 days. The room is sparse and basic, with few amenitites. It was clean, but noisy, with the airport within a stone's throw of the hotel. Planes taking off didn't bother us much as the ac drowned out noise from the planes. There are several eating options within a few blocks of the Coral. Prices for food are reasonable, with everything from fast food to fancy restaurants within 4 blocks in any direction. With the beach only 2 blocks away, an early morning walk made our stay more enjoyable. Buses pass regularly, so for 75 cents gets you to old San Juan in 20 minutes (on the C-53). The way back is much more "daunting" (on the T-5), which was standing room only. You can spend a whole day in old San Juan. It only took us 5 minutes to get to the airport from the Coral. Generally, we felt safe the entire time. You wouldn't want to spend lots of time in your room (stark) but if you're adventurous, it's a reasonable price and there's lots to see and do in close proximity.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: salomeswish
Reviews.Content: We had to extend our stay in San Juan for 2 extra days since all the flights back were full, so I opted to find the best rates for that short period. There was a big puddle outside our room that was a result from busted pipes right above us. They were also fixing the room directly above us, so there was this awful drilling noice that lasted through the night. When I complained to the front desk, I was told that there were no other available rooms and that there was no manager on duty, so tough because you are stuck with where you're at. The beds were just as horrific and we got peppered with bug bites and had to endure the stench coming from the mattresses as well. Stay at Quality Inn (Portal) instead. We were there for the first 6 days of our trip. The rooms are small as well, but clean and well kept. It also comes with blow drier, fridge, coffee machine, continental breakfast and cappuccino maker and computer in the lobby. They also give you beach towels to be used while you are there. Fork the extra $25, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID”
Reviews.Author: jazzsmom2001
Reviews.Content: Just back from a trip to PR with my niece and young daughter, we stayed our last night at Coral by the Sea. I can find nothing positive about the hotel other than close to the airport. Towels looked dirty and were so thin you could see through them. When I took to front desk, I was told that the woman at the desk couldn't get me more towels until after 8 pm (it was 4 pm). When I returned after 8 she handed me some towels--I think the same ones! Around 9 pm there was a knock at the door and I was given 2 newish towels. (Oh, only bath towels no hand towels) Bathroom was dirty and smelled bad. Sheets were so, so I think clean--but no promise on that either! The bed was horrible. Floor was dirty as well. For the money find another place! It is not worth what we paid--about$105/night for two adults and a young child.

Reviews.Title: “Trash by the Sea”
Reviews.Author: nwilson5
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at Coral by the Sea because all other hotels in the Isla Verde area were completely booked. Coral by the Sea was the ONLY hotel that had rooms available. Check in around 2pm, walked into a room that had dirty pillow cases and bed sheets. We asked the maid for new sheets but even the sheets that came right out the dryer had stains on them. In the bathroom there were dirty wrinkled towels that had hair and make-up stains on them. We asked for new towels and the front desk told us it was going to be a while(never got any clean towels)...Went to dinner and came back around 10pm to a room crawling with ants, from both beds to the little desk that was in the room. I had my two year old daughter with me and WAS NOT going to stay in that hotel after seeing that. Luckliy one hotel had exactly One room that had opened up and we went and stayed there. When we told the lady at the front desk the issue she said it wasn't a big deal and that she would give us new sheets. I wanted a refund but she said she was not authorized to give one came back the next morning and filled out a complaint no one has called me back since then and have not refubded my money.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price...”
Reviews.Author: travelcrazy25
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed here for 4 nights and 5 days. For 80 bucks a night you can't go wrong...when we arrived, it did take a few mins to check in but the receptionist was friendly and helpful. We did have some trouble opening/closing the door, you need to fidget with the lock a little (I know sounds annoying). The room was clean when we got there (It was kinda old so thats why it may seem unclean)...we had requested a fridge and there it was...AC worked well...the service was pretty good, they met all of our requests, from getting us extra towels to making sure our shower water was hot..no real complains actually (just that the hotel's a little old and it kinda has that "old smell"). The only time we were in the room was for sleep and shower anyway...we had breakfast one day at the restaurant Piu Bello (crepes were good, fresh fruit was not so fresh and one of my friends ordered pancakes, but apparently they were bad)...there are many restaurants/fast food places just walking distance from this hotel. The bus stop is just down the block (much cheaper than taking a taxi, 75cents vs. $20 to old san juan) Also, El San Juan Hotel is just down the block (club brava is located inside the hotel) Walking at anytime of the day/night is fine/safe (we did and we were all girls). If you're on a budget def stay here, next time I think I will stay at either the Verdanza or El San Juan Hotel though b/c it was embarrasing telling people where we were staying HAHA ***Oh, and to the question on the bottom it's a YES and NO, yes if you're on a budget but no if you have money to blow***

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shalymar
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room here to spend the night with my husband before he flew back to California. It started out bad. I had to wait around 10 minutes to check in because I arrived close to shift change and had to wait until they made me wait until they counted out the money from the till. When she finally checked me in she wasn't very friendly at all. When I finally made it to my room I had to struggle to open the door because it was slightly broken. Once we walked in we saw that it looked old and dirty. The dresser had someone elses clothes in it, which did't make me at all comfortable with sleeping in that bed. We had trouble turning on the air conditioning in a room that was extremely hot and when we went to call the front desk from the phone there was absolutely no dial-tone. The bathroom didn't look clean at all and there were no towels. After we saw the room we demanded our money back and ended up booking a room at the airport hotel. Coral by the Sea was horrible! Will never ever go back there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Flea pit by the sea (well near the sea and nearer the airport)”
Reviews.Author: notreadytogo
Reviews.Content: This was a one night stay, thank goodness i could not have done more. It really is a pit. Dirty, bugs, basic and noisy. Best part of the stay was the taxi ride back to the airport to get away nwxt morni g. Dont ruin your trip to PR. Avoid this place

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment-not a hotel is a guesthouse misleading pictures on internet”
Reviews.Author: steelcitywoman
Reviews.Content: ok so I went to Puerto Rico to get out of Pittsburgh for a while. VERY MISLEADING PICTURES ON THE INTERNET!!! It's actually a guesthouse, not a hotel. No complimnetary anything, like coffee and breakfast in the morning. Staff was rude. Across the street from this place is an abandoned restuarant, and there is garbage on the street on the way to the beach. Puerto Rico is a dump, with the waves of our bad economy rearing it's ugly head in this "paradise" I didn't feel very well after eating in the diner attached to the hotel. Very, very basic rooms. You have to walk down the street to the beach- not exactly "steps" as advertised. They did repeatedly ask me for a credit card upon check in. But it beats paying $300-$400 a night to walk through garbage and abandoned properties. Let's not forget the gunshots I heard in close proximity my first night there.

Reviews.Title: “Please Avoid this Identity Theft Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WatchingYourAct
Reviews.Content: Avoid identity theft at this place. The 3 front desk clerk staff nembers that were working during the last week of May 2010 and first week in June 2010 were incredibly responsible for charging my credit card with their personal electric bills, telephone bills, cellular phone bills, T-Mobile phone bills, CLARO phone bills, Cable television service, Internet service and other miscellaneous services for the grand theft of $2700.00. Not only was their hotel a mess, they also conducted their personal business by charging my credit card for all their personal bills. I didn't go to Puerto Rico to get fleeced by this band of thugs. This hotel is under F.B.I. , Dept. of Elderly Abuse and Police Investigation for their part in Identity Theft of an elderly American citizen. We will prosecute these criminals to the fullest extent of the law for their crime.

Reviews.Title: “DO YOURSELF A FAVOR.....PASS THIS ONE BY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shezavixen2
Reviews.Content: I travel for a living and this hotel is by far one of the very worst I have ever been in!!! This hotel stay was booked sight unseen by friends via viewing the photos on the internet. What false advertising folks.....these photos must have been taken 20 years ago. I stayed almost a week due to circumstances beyond my control......and during that time the sheets were NEVER changed and the towels appeared to have been folded back up and re-hung instead of changed! The hotel staff was very disinterested and unfriendly. The only plus is it was VERY close to the airport.....so much in fact that if push came to shove you could walk it! There was a supermarket close by and a Walgreens. Beach was about a block away but area is very rundown! Just down the street about half a mile are all of the "nicer hotels" and many of the "fast food" places people are used to from the U.S. I would recommend eating at Mi Casita which is traditional and very close by. The restaurants in the hotel are expensive and the food is not worth it. The hotel was noisy and smelled very much like mold!!! Upon closer inspection....found mold in the ice bucket and window ledges. Do yourself a favor......."Pass this one up Folks"!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, a little overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: carloatx
Reviews.Content: Great location for this hotel, right on Isla verde ave, and 2 blocks away from the best beach in the San Juan area. Rooms were ok, i thought the place was overpriced though, but then again, most places in the san juan area are. Air conditioner didn't work to well.

Reviews.Title: “Low frills-super convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Paris1273
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short and sweet. My family and I were arriving in Puerto Rico very late and needed a clean, safe, basic hotel for the evening. That is what you get with Coral by the Sea. The room is on the small side and we inspected the beds with flashlights and saw no problems. The bathroom is quite small and again just has a basic sink (no room for tolietries), a toilet, and a shower. If you are looking for a room with frills this is not the place to stay. If you want a room to crash for the night as you journey to other parts of the island, this serves its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much!”
Reviews.Author: vegosaurus
Reviews.Content: I don't know about you, but I'm not crazy about spending $100 on a hotel and having it be pretty much a dump. If you want location, you have it here....but that's about it. It's right on the Isla Verde main strip and just a couple of blocks from the crowded beach. It's also very close to the airport and just about the cheapest hotel in the area you can find. The room is very small, bathroom so small it's hard to move around in and just the bare basics. It was fairly clean, but not at all inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Great for last night stay and quick trip to airport but not much more”
Reviews.Author: mommyofabailey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my fiance, son and fiance's brother and his girlfriend the last night of our trip. We got a room with double queen beds which was very spacious. It was not the greatest of places being that it was pretty beat up. It was however in a great location being only 5 minutes from the airport and rather cheap. I wouldnt recommend this hotel for a long stay but for your last night and a quick trip to the airport it was great. Also the restuarant downstairs has amazing food. It was quite expensive but everything tasted wondeful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hated It! And I am not one to complain...”
Reviews.Author: Luvs2Trvl_10
Reviews.Content: I hated this hotel! And I usually dont care where I stay. I travel a lot and i usually look for things on the cheaper side Because i am only 21 so i like to save my money to spend on things while i am on vacation and yea i read reviews and thought hmm well i always stay at cheaper hotels and they usually arent that bad. Well this was. There is no beach out front. You have to walk down a ghetto ally to get to the beach. Our room was just gross i swear we had bed bugs. I showered with with sandals on. It just didnt feel clean. I dont mind things being older and not super fancy but this just wasent cool. If you just need a place to stay for one night to sleep then yea its fine. If you are on vacation then NO! Bad idea! There was a really nice hotel next door and its quite a bit more expensive but i called my mom and had her change our reservations after staying at coral by the sea for 2 nights. We made friends while we were on the beach in puerto rico and they walked us home at night and they could not believe we were staying there and said they would pay for us to get a new room because they also were disgusted by our room. They said they didnt think us young girls should be staying there alone. (it was me an 2 of my girlfriends) The hotel next door was the El San Juan Hotel and Casino (The Waldorf Astoria Collection) And we LOVED it there! it was way better! We then went on a cruise and when we got off the cruise we stayed in a different hotel for a day and it also was very nice. It was the Condrad San Juan Condado Plaza And that was also very nice and not to expensive. Any questions feel free to ask! And coral by the sea did not have night life we had to go next door to go to the clubs and bars.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for and what you get isn't bad”
Reviews.Author: krokro
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights last week for a pre cruise sojourn. We chose Coral by the Sea solely on its' relatively reasonable price point. The reviews were not too intimidating, so we took the chance and we're glad we did. Granted, the place is a little rough around the edges. No toiletries other than a thin bar of soap-the shower control came off in my hand and the elevator had a Bronx housing project feel about it. HOWEVER, the entire staff could not have been more gracious and helpful. The bed was comfortable enough and the A/C and the flat screen TV worked perfectly. The location was perfect for what we were looking for. The beach is a two minute walk away, there is a Walgreen's right next store,there are many really good restaurants nearby,, a car rental agency(Via's) is literaly a stone's throw away and the El San Juan and the Ritz Carleton, with their Casinos, are within a 3 minute stroll . It was all we could ask for. For those fussy travelers who have a Hampton Inn type of minimum standard for accommodations, Coral by the Sea will inevitably disappoint. But if you're looking for an inexpensive, reasonably clean ,safe place to stay in an unbeatable location this is a good choice. PS.With the money you save, splurge on Plato's Corner restaurant attached to the hotel. It was sublime! Really good, authentic Puerto Rican cuisine with world class service. Give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't go there.”
Reviews.Author: strange
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews but I am not fussy. I called them and got a room for about 76 bucks including tax. Just needed a room so I could fly out in the morning. No shampoo, hair dryer, internet is slowest ever. Do they care? No.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent for the money”
Reviews.Author: Steamrabbit
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews of this place on Trip Advisor, I was a little worried. But the stay was going to be free, paid for through my Delta Skymiles so I decided to chance it. I can see how someone might be disappointed if their entire traveling experience consisted of major American hotel chains. If the Holiday Inn is your sole basis of comparison then you will be disappointed. No little bottle of shampoo, the TV didn't work properly, and you have to let the shower run for a few minutes before you get any hot water. This kind of thing is why the hotel is as inexpensive as it is. However, the place was very clean. Having seen some reviews from people here about poor maid service at this hotel, I decided to do an experiment. On the first day, I left no tip. The result was a poorly-made bed and some crumbs I had deliberately left on the floor were not swept up, etc. Then on every day thereafter I left a $2 tip. It should come as no surprise that the service improved 100%. Please remember that these women have a fairly unpleasant job that many people would consider demeaning and they get paid next to nothing in what is practically a third world country. Put yourself in their shoes and just give them the tip they deserve. You will see a difference. The staff were unfailingly polite and helpful to me in response to my treatment of them as equals. Yet I observed some of these same people giving the cold shoulder to tourists checking in at the desk who failed to use words like 'please' and 'thank you.' Bad manners led to receiving bad service. I think that perhaps there is just a cultural difference here that guests need to get used to. At a major chain hotel run by an American corporation, all employees are expected to give excellent treatment even to crappy, rude, non-tipping guests. Here in Puerto Rico, at a locally-owned hotel, normal human nature seems to be permitted to dominate. As someone who tries to make a point of having good manners, I'm pretty ok with that. My room was totally fine and I would have been happy paying up to around $70 a night for what I got. Clean linens, comfortable bed, clean bathroom, reliable wi-fi, no bugs and there was air conditioning. There is a public beach only a few blocks away and the neighborhood was completely safe and well-policed at all hours. The point of the trip was not to sit in a room for 4 nights and 5 days - it was to see San Juan. I only really came back to the room to sleep and check my email. I would definitely stay at the Coral by the Sea again.

Reviews.Title: “Great cruise location”
Reviews.Author: wildpony67
Reviews.Content: Last FEB 2009, Stayed HERE WITH ANOTHER COUPLE That we cruise with. GREAT Resturant, Great location, AND THEY EVEN GET YOU TO THE CRUISE SHIP.............What more does anyone want for $100. BUCKS. ! The employees were outstanding, big smiles and very helpful with our hundred questions as where should we go locally. They were just great. Just booked a few minutes ago for our 2010 cruise ! see you then Pat and Bob Smith

Reviews.Title: “Depressing”
Reviews.Author: catcapellaro
Reviews.Content: Okay, I didn't have high expectations, but this hotel looks out onto a crumbling building, it has zero charm, and has small, cramped rooms. I'd expect to pay much less for staying in such a charmless, depressing setting. It's across from a strip of chains and a cockfighting facility. The staff was fine, however. The Gelato place downstairs has a pretty crappy breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Upmost friendly and wellcoming”
Reviews.Author: kata7ina
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with stand by-tickets and got stuck in San Juan on my way from JFK to Martinque via San Juan. I stayed two nights in CORAL By tht Sea 16-18th of November 2009. The hotels exellent price and location (near to the airport) made me happy. The best feature though was ever so friendly night portier. This WARM and LOVELY person made me feel welcome at 1 am when I arrived to the hotel. He was ever so helpful and gave me a good idea of PUERTORICAN HOSPITALITY. I would like to go back to Puerto Rico one day and visit rainforest, music clubs and more. My baggage was already in Martinique so I travelled extra lite (meaning: nothing). From the nearby drugstore I could purchase toothbrush etc next morning and 24h open restaurant few steps away served a delicious Mofongo de yuca con camarones(greyfish) at 2am. Coral by the Sea was CLEAN and FRIENDLY. Best wishes from Jaana from Finland! :D

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, But With Good Service”
Reviews.Author: NJWil
Reviews.Content: Coral By The Sea is definitely a budget hotel, but is a good choice for students or others looking for inexpensive accommodations in a prime location close to the beach and/or airport. The hotel is showing signs of age, and the rooms are rather small; bathroom has a shower stall, not a full bath. There is free parking, definitely a plus, but the parking lot is quite small (so parking may not be available to everyone who wants it). The rooms are sparsely furnished (but there isn't room for much), but the beds are comfortable and I found the room to be clean. The hotel has free wireless internet, and a restaurant (I cannot comment more on the restaurant, as I didn't dine there). The attentiveness of the staff is superior; the lady at check-in went out of her way to give exact directions to the airport, even going outside to show me how to get eastbound on Isla Verde Ave. from the parking lot. I had a wake-up call at 3:45 AM -- wake-up call was on time, and then the front desk called again at 4 AM just to make sure that we were up. So the hotel, in my view, gains points for customer service. I would recommend this hotel for the budget-minded, but those who expect greater amenities should look elsewhere. Also, don't expect a room with a view!

Reviews.Title: “could be better”
Reviews.Author: tinanyc2009
Reviews.Content: There is no picture of the room and amenities when you are trying to choose. It is very deceptive with the wording . The bed and furniture could use some updating. A little paint and a decent mattress would help. I spent most of the time by my friends and family who stayed at area hotels. i wanted to change hotels but was informed that it will cost me 2 nights, not worth it. I would suggest to improve or renovate the rooms and charge a little more.

Reviews.Title: “not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: JFebres
Reviews.Content: Not the greatest place to stay but who cares, you only want to sleep on it and that was fabulous nights I spend in there. PLEASE, I lost my camera in PR on July 15, if found please e-mail me at jfebres@comcast.net for address, keep the camera, all I want is the videos. (They are the only memories I have of P.R. after 12 years. jfebres@comcast.net

Reviews.Title: “The Price is Right”
Reviews.Author: travelluvr23
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant initially because of the mixed reviews, but figured for the price I can't really lose. I was more than pleasantly surprised with the staff and the room. The parking was ample and even if you go out they have staff to accommodate your car in the early AM hours. We didn't try the restaurant, but I did notice that they had two of them I believe. I would advise anyone to try this hotel, but don't expect to see the ritzy stuck up people like at the very more expensive hotels near by.

Reviews.Title: “IT SUCKS”
Reviews.Author: prezz2000
Reviews.Content: This was the worst place ever . The elavator did not work they told me I would have to carry my stuff up 7 flights of stares. They where nasty . THE PLACE IS A FIRE DEATH trap. They told my freand that they did not have a crip for his babby but they would give him kid rails to put on the bed. the rooms where dirty no rugs in the rooms. they say they have a pool NOT there is no pool. I would not send my worst enmy there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Magger63
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff and good location. Beach in 3 minute walk. Only old San Juan a little away.

Reviews.Title: “Only the Cheap People would Stay!”
Reviews.Author: aventnyc
Reviews.Content: I stood in Coral By the Sea for 2 nights and that was enough. The location is superb it could not get any better. I was suprised when I saw a flat screen in the room. The bed was overall good, the bathroom was filthy. It has an elevator(good)but it usually doesnt function and when the door opens you could trip off while exiting which i did and hurt myself. The service is horrible, they only take good care of the "outsiders". Like i said, only the cheap people would stay. After 2 nights i gave up and went to another hotel across the street. So dont bother just spending a couple of dollars more in another hotel because this one is sad.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified hostel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: salsa10233
Reviews.Content: I was traveling solo this time and wanted to experience Puerto Rico for myself, not just staying at a resort all day. So, I decided to stay at Coral by the Sea which was about $76/night all in for a single bed room. My stay for four nights was quite pleasant because I was using the hotel only as a base and did not stay there unless I was sleeping. That said, unless you are accustomed to sleeping through fairly loud air conditioners and a plane going by once in a while, this place will be quiet enough for you. Even the Ritz which is right next door endures the plane sounds. You will have to let the water run in the shower for about 7 minutes before any warm/hot water comes out. The sink did not seem to have hot water flowing even though there was a hot water faucet and pipe. They provide two bath towels and one towel for the floor- these towels smell like bleach (which is good) but they are very thin and sometimes slightly stained. The bed was somewhat comfortable as were the pillows. The sheets smelled clean, but there were stains here and there and sometimes even a random hair. The rooms contain a small LCD TV, a [dirty] chair, plastic cups, ice bin (not sure if an ice machine is available however) and an armoir. I noticed some insect bait in the room but never saw one insect. The elevator is slow but works and a nice perk about the hotel is the free parking. I imagine during busy times will be hard to find parking as the lot fits about 15-20 cars. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Internet access really is only available in the lobby which is a pain, and while I was there the hotel's internet access was down, so I was leaching from one of the connected restaurants (Platos). The hotel is in a great location, with two connected restaurants (Platos is expensive however) where you will receive a 10% discount for showing your room key. Walgreens is nestled in between this hotel and the Ritz, and both the Ritz and Walgreens are 5 minutes away. I spent a day at the Ritz's spa which was great because it's so close. There is also Burger King, Chilis, Ruth's Chris Steakhouse, Taco Bell and others located on the strip of hotels all within 10 minutes of walking distance to this hotel. The beach is about 4 minutes away by walking. Via driving, Old San Juan is 20 minutes away, Luquillo Beach 35 minutes, El Yunque rainforest 35 minutes, Seven Seas Beach (near the Bioluminescent Bay) 45 minutes and the ferry to Culebra 50 minutes. If you want just the basics, this hotel is for you, but because every hotel in this area is expensive, Coral by the Sea is a good value relative to the area- it is just an overpriced hostel.

Reviews.Title: “quaint lil hotel”
Reviews.Author: notinjuschillin
Reviews.Content: I too was taken aback by the reviews I read but I had to book a room because I was on a strict budget. so let me address a few things... The cold shower..if you are a native puerto rican as I am then you are accustomed to cold showers. So that was fine with me. The staff is very friendly...and the restuarant is cheap, conveinent, and the food is good. There is a Walgeens and the Isla Verde mall close by, like a 2 minute walk from the front door of the hotel. The beach is a 5 minute walk..get there early to grab the free beach chairs. So I rate this hotel a 3 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, if you don't mind a cold shower”
Reviews.Author: tcal23
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the heart of Isla Verde, where some of the best beaches and attractions in San Juan are located. However, on three out of five days our room was never made up, at times the hot water would stop working (which was horrible if you had just made it back from the beach and were planning on showering before dinner), and the staff was unwilling to accommodate any extra requests (including asking for a receipt upon checkout). If you can't afford anything more expensive in the area I would say to stay here just because of the location, but if you can afford a few extra bucks I would recommend looking around.

Reviews.Title: “Dont be misled”
Reviews.Author: appleblossoms
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative about Coral by the Sea Hotel I was a bit hesistant to stay there. Being on a tight budget and only needing one night in Puerto Rico I threw caution to the wind and decided I will stay there. I was very much pleasantly surprise by the staff eagerness to serve. At least 4 other people was checking in at the same time I was and Diana/Diane was just great and very professional not to mention fast and effecient in checking us in (I didnt even had reservations). I was in my room in less than 10 mins. Yes, the very small elevator was slow. But for the price who cares!!!!!!! The restaurant on the premises made up for what the hotel lacks. Besides you also get 10% off your meal if you are staying at the hotel. Again, yes the bathroom was indeed very small but who wants to stay in the bathroom the bathroom is only for the 3 S's. Shower, Shave and Sit. The 2 queen size beds in our room was very comfortable and the room was very clean. It does need a little up grading with the furniture and it would have been nice to have a microwave and a refrigerator in the room. But what more can one want for a price like that. Check out was at 12 noon and my meeting lasted after 2 pm and the supervisor on duty was so generous in not charging us an extra day due to the fact that our belongings was still in the room. I will definitely stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Coral by the sea”
Reviews.Author: misawa393
Reviews.Content: After reading some of these reviews, I was way skeptical about staying at this hotel. I'm glad I chose to stay here though. because it was a great experience. The staff was so so helpful. They gave us directions and suggestions on places we should visit. They were very friendly, especially considering that we checked in around midnight. The area is great. Lots of little shops, and places to eat nearby. The beach is right down the street. The room was pretty sparse, and the bathroom was tiny, but the bed was extremely comfortable and we had an lcd tv in our room. For the price, you can't beat it! It's not the Hilton, but its a great option for those of us on a budget. Try the restaraunts downstairs, the food is amazing. So take a chance on Coral by the Sea. Don't let these negative reviews make your decision! See for yourself! It was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great locations, no issues”
Reviews.Author: travelor_for_fun
Reviews.Content: After reading several of the reviews, we were hesitant to book at this hotel due to the issues listed. As rates in the area kept increasing we decided to take a chance with the hotel. Coral by the Sea is very convenient to get to as it is less than 10 minutes to the airport. ALL of the staff was very, very, very helpful with any of your questions on directions, areas to go, restaurants or to just chat with in passing. The hotel is less than a two-minute walk to the EL San Juan and about 5 minutes to the Ritz. Good little local restaurants in the plaza next store and Walgreenâ€™s for all your needs. Yes, the elevator is small and slow but who spends time in there, use the steps!! On my next visit I would stay again as our experience had no issues. Points about the hotel - Free parking with a security guard walking the property - Free WIFI - Great location - we walked to the beach - AC in room worked good but on the last day it was not cooling the room as it may have froze due to the high outside temperatures. - I could hear the airplanes but only a few times and I had to make an effort to listen to hear them. -Bring hangers only 2 in the closet. Definitely not a 3 star property, a Marriott or a Hilton but if you would rater save on the accommodations and put the money towards fun its a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: saltie1721
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this hotel lost my bag in their locked storage room. I had to change my flight and come back early, because I had nothing. They said they weren't responsible and I left it at my own risk. They took no responsibility and even wanted to make me pay for my room! In the middle of the night, I got a call from the front desk and another customer took my bag by accident. I myself paid for his taxi ride back to the hotel to return it. They are very incompetent and untrustworthy. I do realize the workers were 'following orders' from the owners, and this is how they run their business.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Necessities yet, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: ProudAmerican2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three nights while passing through San Juan. At first was thinking of cancelling for another hotel but didn't and was pleased staying there. The employees were very friendly, Room 205 was clean simple good to stay over yet explore the area of San Juan. I would recommend this hotel to someone who isn't a picky person. I found it a bargain for the location and cleaniness of the room. The hotel has plenty of parking without charging. Walking distance to the El San Juan Hotel and close to basically all types of restaurants. I will now stay there everytime I visit San Juan .

Reviews.Title: “Not As Bad AS we Were Expecting”
Reviews.Author: Cincinnati513
Reviews.Content: We had read all the reviews & Honestly we almost cancelled our reservation & stayed somewhere else...Glad we Didn't!! For 80 bucks, This was Perfect! No it is Not No 5 Star hotel...If you want that Go pay the big Bucks!! But for a One or two night stay if was Fine. We stayed for One night PreCruise. The rooms are small, Bathrooms are small But the Place was CLEAN...No Bugs & even had a Nice flat screen TV..Like I said tho.. For the Price it is Perfect! Front desk was Always Helpful & very Nice =)

Reviews.Title: “NOT THAT BAD!!”
Reviews.Author: evk25
Reviews.Content: i read all the reviews and was TERRIFIED to stay here, but honestly it was JUST FINE. my boyfriend (now fiance) had bought us a trip at the end of may 2008 for three nights in puerto rico. we are college students on a college budget and this fit in very nicely. it was our first trip together out of the country. the lady who checked up in was very gracious and very helpful. the elevator IS slow, but really you only need it when you have your luggage. the rest of the time it's just easier to take the stairs (and we were on the third or fourth floor). a shopping mart is within walking distance for groceries and toiletries. the taxi fare from the airport was only about ten dollars. the beach is within walking distance. our room was teeny-tiny, but PERFECTLY CLEAN. i seriously let out a sigh of relief when i opened the door because i was scared to see cockroaches. no stains on the sheet, AC worked just fine (there is a switch on the wall to turn it on), the water-pressure in the shower was fine. everything was SMALL but clean. the best parts are: right next door are the El San Juan Resort and Casino, Ritz, and another big name place. these are so nice to walk through!! check out the casinos and night clubs there for night life, and check out the stores in them for shopping during the day. very fancy, and we got to see them all without even staying there! :-) the beach connects all these resorts, but we didn't try to use their bar or pool because you need a hotel towel (and i'm a wimp lol) also, right downstairs of the coral by the sea is an AMAZING gellato parlor!! the ice cream (gellato) is soooo good. try the mango :-) we didn't eat at the restaurant in the hotel (except for ice cream). there are PLENTY of fast-food places within walking distance, and also VERY nice restaurants within all the five star resorts. DON'T RENT A CAR. DON'T NEED IT AND NO ROOM TO PARK. DRIVERS IN PUERTO RICO ARE OUT OF CONTROL. my boyfriend and i constantly noted how crazy the drivers seemed (swerve in and out of traffic, pulling out of driveways without looking, etc.) in summary, if you are on a budget, feel free to stay here and enjoy the luxuries of the nearby resorts. if you are looking for a five-star resort and have the money for one, stay at the El San Juan Resort and Casino (my favorite :-))

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY DISGUSTED”
Reviews.Author: MsVee56
Reviews.Content: On our way to a Caribbean Cruise, leaving from Puerto Rico, we decided to go a day earlier. We booked rooms at Coral by the Sea. This was the worse experience ever, the lobby was not too impressive, there was just one tiny elevator, and the rooms were horrible. The rooms were very musty, and smelly, it was overall a total let down.

Reviews.Title: “Dump by the sea”
Reviews.Author: kevinkmt
Reviews.Content: Firstly to the men, this is no place to take your woman/wife when you go to the room the toilets are small and crummy,worst of all the toilet/bathroom t has a window by the lobby area (entrance to your room) so anyone passing on your room knows if you are showing or taking a "dump" in the toilet. the rooms don't feel safe and the hotel is lonely and the floors are isolated - there is no internet in the room, the pictures on their website is not a picture of the room its a modied picture of somewhere else. i had to check out immediately!, the front desk guy was very polite though. during the few mins i spent guys with tatoos on their head, gangster looking folks and people who look almost destitute checked in, they were some good folks as well. i moved to the marriot i was only there to economise, i did not stay 10 mins in the room but they still charged my card for the first night !!!! DO NOT STAY HERE i ignored the other reviews and thought they were just spoilt, but it is all true!

Reviews.Title: “Kinda Nasty, Only for young single types”
Reviews.Author: TracElement
Reviews.Content: I've traveled pretty much all over the U.S. and various other countries and have stayed in some less than desirable hotels/motels in 3rd world places, but this was one of the first that really grossed me out a bit. Luckily I was only staying one day when I first moved to PR and i was alone. The bed was ok and seemed to be clean but the bathroom.. eeew.. mold and mildew everywhere. A little mold I can handle, but it was out of control, time for some 409 or something.. Also, I realize the Island is humid and all but everything in the room especially the floor was just kinda sticky and grimey.. nothing really felt clean. The island is beautiful but unfortunately everything in PR is way overpriced especially in San Juan and people here just trash their own Island throwing garbage whereever. As far as people complaining about slow service, well it's island time there is no such thing as speedy.. so you may as well relax and enjoy the 45 minutes or so it takes the person behind to counter to stop talking on the phone, do their nails, finish their lunch, etc etc.. cause honey they don't get paid to work any quicker. To be blunt, I like the island and it has a lot of beautiful things to see, but if you're easily annoyed or don't want to spend a lot of money for the same thing you can get in a lot of other coastal areas get a passport and go somewhere else .

Reviews.Title: “get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: fozzyoz
Reviews.Content: basic room, A/C went out (4th floor) and they had no other room to move us to, they didn't even offer a fan. Moved us the next day.

Reviews.Title: “TRASH by the Sea!!”
Reviews.Author: L0v2travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is horrible!! The rooms are small. About a year ago my friend and I stayed here for 7 days!!!! in a room with a double bed and twin bed. We barely had room to squeeze our way to the tiny bathroom. The ceilings were stained and the beds had bed bugs! I slept on top of the covers in a sleeping bag and still got bit!! The elevator worked but was so small only 2 people with carry on luggage could fit at one time. So we walked up and down the cement, "bust your head wide open," uneven stairs quiet often. Every 10 mins a plane flew overhead rumbling the entire building and I'm not a light sleeper, but the noise level was ridiculous. We had to chase and beg the cleaning staff for "fresh" towels. There's no shelving or countertop space in the bathroom so we had to keep all of our toiletries in our suitcases. Only 1 or 2 people at the desk speak English so communication was strained at best. The staff is nice enough but extremely slow with service. Also there's a restaurant connected to the "hotel" that's overpriced with poor quality food. The ONLY good thing about this place is it's proximity to the beach and quality hotels. If you're visiting P.R. and want to enjoy your stay....don't book with this hotel!!! My friend and I are 20 somethings and single and are pretty tolerant of little annoyances plus we didn't spend much time in our room (for good reason) but this place is completely unattractive, unacceptable and a waste of money. I wonder how many illegal construction and health citations this place would have if inspected by U.S. standards. Trust me when I say spend the extra money for a nice hotel!!! Especially if you're traveling with children!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: nhtm0218
Reviews.Content: This service is right for the price. We stayed a week here. Even though the room is cleaned everyday, there is always a bit of sand on the bed and the floor. Keep in mind this is not a five-star. There is no fridge, no microwave, and no coffee/water... An ice-maker is on the same floor: free ice. The shower is small but good: strong hot/cold water. The TV signal often goes on and off so don't expect to finish a full 30min show without at least 10 interruptions. It's 5 minutes from the beach. We just crash here at night so it doesn't matter. The staffs are friendly. Food in Puerto Rico sucks and ridiculously expensive but it's a different story.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: pookins
Reviews.Content: Ok so after living on the island and having family there,reading the reviews didn't scare me that much. you are talking about a small island where the crime rates are high, and minimum wage is 5.15. as far as the neighborhood goes i personally knew what to expect from different parts of the island. you have to use your street smarts when traveling to puerto rico. don't get me wrong i love the island but there are nicer places to stay less than 5 minutes down the street that didn't have people hanging in the entryway in the middle of the night and just looked more safe and comfy. the staff was nice though. the room was very small and the whole 3 nights we stayed the sheets were not washed once so you could feel the gritty sand on the sheets. i could tell they were clean when we got there cuz you could smell the bleach. the elevator is small and very slow. the parkinglot behind the hotel wasn't great and i would never go out there alone at night. the ac didn't work all that great. they did clean up our rooms daily though but not the greatest. no bugs though! it wasn't horrible but it wasn't great. as a puerto rican american all i want to say is travel the island and enjoy it. it's a beautiful place. but if you're looking for a romantic,cozy get away for you and your partner then the coral by the sea isn't for you.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant Plato at Coral by the Sea Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCMM7
Reviews.Content: We had a bad experience at this restaurant. The salad was "old" and the food was greasy. My freind got sick after we dined there. She even spent a night at the ER afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: Madison557
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights, checking in on Wednesday and checking out on Sunday. After reading all the negative reviews, we were somewhat worried, but the staff treated us with smiles. We asked for advice on places to go (restuarants/groceries), and we received courteous advice. Our room was clean (no cockroaches), and the maids cleaned our room each day, including washing all the sand out of our shower and cleaning up the seaweed on the floor from our numerous beach excursions. We got clean towels every single day. The hotel is not far from the beach (~2 blocks). This is a place to sleep and shower. Please do not expect it to be more than it is. If you want luxury, stay at the El San Juan or the Ritz Carlton. You don't really need a pool when you have the ocean a short walk away! In addition, we felt perfectly safe. Our lock was secure, the neighborhood is not particularly dangerous, and there is always someone at the front desk by the only unlocked door at night. We did not eat at Plato's, as it was too expensive, but Piu Bello had delicious food at very affordable prices compared to other restuarants in the area. Many places are open 24 hours, so room service really isn't necessary. If you don't plan to spend a ton of time in the hotel, stay here and save your money for dining and exploring this beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Dumpy”
Reviews.Author: lululaura
Reviews.Content: This place is a dive. Filthy, beat up, run down, trashy. I should of known by the trash outside of the front door. Staff was rude. Elevators were extremely slow. Doors didn't lock safely. Horrible, do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “cheap”
Reviews.Author: happyfrappie
Reviews.Content: A friend and I just returned from a trip to Puerto Rico for spring break. We read the reviews expecting the worst. Coral by the sea was better than we expected. Sure it's not the Ritz Carlton, but it's a place to sleep and the price was great for our budget. It's really close to the airport and the beach and it's a 25-30 minute bus ride to Old San Juan! My only complaint would be that it was a little noisy as you could feel the planes at the airport taking off. I'd recommend it for students and people who want to go to the beach and have money to spend on adventures in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Dog Day Afternoon”
Reviews.Author: BMG4310
Reviews.Content: what a dump. infested with roaches molds, that I wold not let dog stay there. I book the hotel, paid for it, but could not stay there at all., Had to pay for one day, because I gave them my credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Awful for most,alright for a few”
Reviews.Author: callyhuh
Reviews.Content: Well what I mean is that most people will find this hotel completely repulsive, but for a few it may just fit their needs.Me and my girlfriend went to this hotel for one nite post-cruise to wind down and had an early flight the next A.M. We splurged on a nice hotel pre-cruise so just wanted a cheap place to lay our heads for one last nite. Everything you read in the reviews is VERY true. The lobby is alright but once you get inside the elevator and make the slow(so slow in fact It makes no noise and you feel as though you may be stuck) ascension to your floor you feel an eerie chill like your in Hostel 4 or somethin. Once the elevator jolts to your destinating floor you get off in a dark hallway with metal doors.As for the room-very basic. I didn't think it was that bad but my GF was appalled. She was so upset she wanted nothing more than to get out for dinner come back and sleep and get out ASAP.At first i noticed the AC wasnt working and when I went down to ask(the room phone couldn't reach the front desk-at least I couldn't figure it out.) I got lucky since the front desk person apparently abandoned the front desk to show a prospective sucker what the rooms looked like. He assured me the AC did in fact work -all you had to do was flick a switch on the wall-a first for me.I then mentioned that our room had no wash clothes could I get a couple. He advised me that the hotel did not provide wash clothes. After a sweaty day we were forced to use one of our towels for a wash cloth then share the other towel to dry off.Once again not a really big deal to me but obviously a lady would have a much different perspective on it. The bed seemed clean and the sheets had a smell of bleach, the room overall was very simple and dingy but wasnt overly dirty that I found-the tile floor a little gritty like sand. We found the people at the front desk very helpful actually and never had a problem with the parking. They have surveillence of the lot at the front desk and there was a guy helping us out each time we parked. So that wasn't a problem for us but it is a rather small parkin lot so I could imagine the issues pointed out in other reviews. It IS about a 3 block walk to the beach-but not a very pleasant one-garbage ridden alleys,fenced in condos, etc. Overall the area was very dark at nite and gave you a general feeling of unsafeness. It WAS very close to some of the nicest hotels in Isle Verde area but Isle Verde even though in the tourist area seemed rather unsavory to me.The type of place where call girls and drug lords come to life after midnight. I felt MUCH safer staying in Condado and I even felt safer walkin the streets of Ole San Juan in the wee hours of the morning than walking around this area. Overall it was the cheapest I could find at 100$ a nite and it served the purpose for me. I wouldn't suggest it for couples or family who have never went camping or stayed in hostels in their past-this hotel would be a shock to their system. Oh one more good thing is it is a mile to Charlies car rental on the same street which is very convenient to drop off and get to the airport in less than 15 minutes time.There was also a string of very good Italian restaurants down the street and a very good place for authentic PR food called Maria somethin or another. I hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “You'll Be Sorry!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaDreamin16
Reviews.Content: All the negative reviews are right. I booked a room in this hotel for 1 week as parted of an online vacation package. Let me tell you there is a reason why there are only a few selects photos on the hotels web site ( lobby, outside entrance , and restaurant), and thats because this place is old ,run down in a state of neglect, and dirty. The elevatator (1) is tiny and doesnt work right. On the inside of the elevator there is grafatti (gang symbols, etc) , once you arrive on your floor the lighting is poor , it makes you feel as if you are walking down a dark alley and about to be attacked, the doors of the rooms are dented, painted chipped and the room numbers are big , white stenciled on the doors. Inside the room you will see discolored ceiling tiles some , moisture buckling, shotty tile work, dust bunnies under the bed , hair in the shower (very small), no coffee pot, towels with numbers penciled on, staff who act as if they are annoyed, apathetic, and indifferent , if you have any issues or ask any questions ( they dont even want to call a taxi for you when you check out). I know this place is rated 1 1/2 stars but dont believe it , this is a dump. I went for the cheapest price, and got BURNT!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Dave030
Reviews.Content: The hotel was small, which we expected. We booked this hotel for one day prior to leaving on a 10-day cruise and then for two days upon our return. We confirmed our reservations for a price of $89.00 a night. When we arrived they wanted to charge us $121.00 and insisted we sign their credit card receipt even though we contested the price and showed them a confirmation of the rate. The dest clerk insisted we sign the credit card receipt and told us by signing we were not agreeing to the price. I showed her where it specifically said we were agreeing to the price. After a half an hour of demanding we talk to the manager she finally got the manager. The manager was not much better in resolving the problem. We finally convinced her to call the toll free number and confirm our price. When we asked about sites to see and/or tours to take we were advised they didn't have any information for us. The elevator is very small, so if you have more that two people and two small bags you will have to make several trips. There are zero amenities in your hotel room. Tolet paper and towels are the extent of the amenities. There are no electrical outlets in the very small bathrooms and no hangers to hang your clothes. They have an ajoining restaruant which we ate at twice. The food was good but the cook only prepares one dish at a time. I ordered Oatmeal, toast and coffee for breakfast and my wife ordered coffee and pancakes. We got the individually made cup of coffee first (no refills), 5 minutes later I got my bowl of oatmeal and 5 minutes later I got my toast and 10 minutes later my wide got her pancakes. The server never came to the table to ask if we wanted anything else including a refill on the water. We had to chase him down to get our bill. Do to the slow service and bad attitude we would not recommend this facility to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: truck2401
Reviews.Content: I read the negative reviews but our stay was great. The hotel staff was helpful and the airconditioner was fridget( very cold). stayed on the 5th floor and it was nice. Near the airport so you hear the planes if they are using the runway near the hotel.A bus stop is near the hotel that will take you to Old San Juan ($.75 correct change).Resturants near by and 2 in the hotel area. Overall the hotel was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste your money.”
Reviews.Author: AnaliaMiami
Reviews.Content: For my husband and I were the worst vacation we had. Please look for another hotel. Read all the negative comments, I agree with everyone. Rooms dirty, employees are not friendly, no parking, horrible, the food was. Restaurant looks dirty and the food is not good. The Isla Verde beach is beautiful and San Juan a very special place, so enjoy your trip and go to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Platos Restaurant is the best in town”
Reviews.Author: Coralito
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. The restaurant Plato' s is the best in town... Beach walking distance...

Reviews.Title: “Disaster by the Sea”
Reviews.Author: induetime
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the weekend of June 22nd through the 24th. I'll make this short....find another place to stay! I'm doing them a favor of posting an enhanced picture of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: candelanj
Reviews.Content: Parking always full. Hotel dirty. Room nasty. Staff have no respect and no class. The first thing that greet me at the room was a big cucaracha crawling in the wall it was enough for me to turn around..... San Juan Beach Hotel at the condado were I had to got to... was great!

Reviews.Title: “if you are adventuress or love to travel alone.”
Reviews.Author: joebell19
Reviews.Content: My package deal included the round-trip non-stop flight to Puerto-Rico and the seven night stay at Coral By The sea and for the price I paid, the hotel was okay! The staff treated me well and kept my room extremely clean and well stocked at all times. If you love the beach and also enjoy have many assorted choices of restaurants to eat in,Isla Verde is the place,Plus they have a supermarket not too far from the hotel and a good walk for those who enjoy exercising .The Bus stops near the hotel as well and for 75 cents per trip, you can be in old san juan in a heartbeat but don't expect to find any kind of nightlife at all in Isla Verde ,it don't exist! I judged this hotel differently because I'm a frequent visitor to the Caribbean and South America and many of their hotels cost twice as much and in worse condition,So I guess the enjoyment one can get by staying at Coral by the sea is in the eyes of the beholder.Whatever you do enjoy yourself and remember You are on Vacation!(smile)

Reviews.Title: “Loved PR hated Coral By the Sea”
Reviews.Author: lvstrvlNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: The entrance was ok but once you get in the elevator (which only fits two people at atime) and go to your floor you feel as if you're in a bad horror movie, the rooms are dirty and the sheets and blankets are badly stained . We booked this through hotwire and paid $85.00 a night not expecting much in the way of amenities (my husband and i are not hard to please at all)but at least hoped for a clean hotel ...not even close. Honestly the sight and smell of the rooms and hallways almost made me sick to my stomach I could see paying maybe paying $25.00 a night for this hotel but nothing more. Iwould never stay there again and I beg you even if this price is appealing its not worth ruining your trip STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!! On the other hand I PR its soooo beautiful and if you go please visit the beaches in Fajardo and the El Yunque Rain Forest. BUT DONT STAY AT CORAL BY THE SEA!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: vagabondny
Reviews.Content: We just got back from PR this week. Booked this hotel as a package deal, so did not pay much overall. The hotel is not great, but it is not bad either. Good things include: Close to the San Juan beach, nice neighbourhood with lots of eating options, decent-sized, clean rooms, daily housekeeping Cons: Staff not friendly (the only bunch of unsmiling people in the country of Puerto Rico!), old rooms If you plan to be outdoors most of the time and would like to be close to the airport/metro area, this is good option. If you expect a grand hotel with luxuries and staff catering to all your needs, forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Less than what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: ctorres511
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for $84 a night through Hotwire as a 1 star hotel. It was a lot less than what I expected. This is NOT a hotel, it is an extremely cheap MOTEL. The entrance is ok. The receptionist area, is very out dated. The technology they use is also outdated. We had to park in the street because there was no parking in their20 spot parking lot. The elevator is really small. Myself, husband and 1 large suitcase and 1 small suitcase took up most of the space. We didn't not have an iron in our room so we asked for one, and didn't get it until the next morning after 3 phone calls. When we got it we then asked for an ironing board. They DON'T have any. Great! So we ironed one of the double beds. One is a full size and the other a twin. The ceilings are drop ceilings and have MANY water stains. The remote for the TV didn't work. They shut off the A/C when you are not there. So you come in to a extremely hot room. The bathroom is built for one person to be in there at a time. Their cheap towels are numbers with a permanent marker (as if you want to steal a cheap towel). They don't even wrap around your waist, I'm a sixe 4 (small). Don't ask for additional ones, they don't have extra. We used the same towels for 3 nights. The shower is about 6 Feet tall with a nasty shower curtain. Any conversation done in the bathroom is heard by the entire floor. The closet has no door. the Lighting in the room is extremely cheap and gross. The restaurants that they advertise, give you a 10% discount but their prices are comparable with Applebee's. We ended up checking out early (being charged for it) and sleeping the last night at the Embassy Suites (3 star hotel) down the street.

Reviews.Title: “The Bates Motel not Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danko2038
Reviews.Content: I booked into this location via there Web Site. Upon arriving I was assigned a room on the second floor. to where I took the elevator. Upon exiting the elevator, the second floor hallway which was very dim, with no lights. As I walked to my room which was the last room down a small hallway, all the other rooms in this area had there doors open as if they were being repaired. and garbage throw all about with each and every door open causing danagours condition to everyone. (Very easy for anyone to enter this premises and gain access to the 2nd Floor) Upon arriving at my room I noticed that the door was not a secure door, that if you leaned against it, that it would open. The room was not what it was pictured in there Web Site, further more there was modes all over the bathroom window and floor by the toilet. At which point (Not there more than minute) I did return to the front desk and complained about the conditions,to where the staff became very nasty and still charged my credit card, which I am disputing. As a retired NYC Police Detective, (not putting anyone) this reminds me a Short Stay Welfare Hotel (Very nasty and dirty)

Reviews.Title: “don't even try”
Reviews.Author: laffy
Reviews.Content: i made a reservation from my home town of Ponce, but before leaving to N.Y. me and my children decided to enjoy a nice stay at this hotel. I booked from my hometown and away we went. when we got there the building looked like a hospital the entrance was quiete welcoming but when we went inside it smelled like roach i told the guy in the front desk can we see our room he said sure is on the fourth floor well guess what when we got on the elevator it looked like a tiny freight elevator when we got upstairs it looked like a quickie hotel we looked inside the room and we ran down like chickens my daughter tells the receptionist this is horrible my city projects looks better the guy said well because you made reservation you will be booked for one night and i told him well that was not told to me i really didn't care i just wanted to get the hell out of there. the main entrance is a catch kind of welcoming but wait and see you. will regret by giving your credit card number first. We left and stayed at the Empress Hotel just by the beach we had a great time there at this other hotel. Beware my people!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “" Horror By the Sea"”
Reviews.Author: abeachbunni
Reviews.Content: Initially, I was excited as this was my first time in Puerto Rico. I was equally excited because we had such a good rate on our lodging, flight and hotel via Priceline.com. From the moment we established contact with this establishment, we encountered sub-standard service. Upon our arrival to town, I called the hotel to get directions. I talked to two people who gave me very "vague" directions. My reservation documentation confirmed a check in time of 1pm, yet upon confirming our arrival via phone, we were told that check in time wasn't until 3pm. From this point, throughout the duration of our stay, each day we encountered a sub-standard service, event or occurrence. Upon checking into our room, we found bath towels the size of hand towels, no hand towels or face cloths. The baths towels were the consistency of a dish towel, (very thin and not very absorbent). The room , (and specifically the bathroom) had a musty odor that wouldn't seem to dissipate even after opening windows. Even thought this was a non-smoking room, it reeked of cigarette smoke. The bedspreads and bed linen were visibly soiled Later that evening we encountered ROACHES crawling over our toiletries.
