When we expressed our horror to the front desk, they provided a nonchalant "sorry about that" and sent the maintenance porter to our room to give us a can of roach spray to console us. The front desk offered to move us to another room for one night, then move us to another room again, (because they were at full capacity, nonetheless, this was an inconvenience solution). Because it was late in the evening, we kept the can of roach spray and stayed in the room. We didn't get much sleep thinking about the roach infestation. As Priceline's policy states no refunds, we were very unhappy with the way this hotel turned out. The next day, we were told by the manager/owner, that we would be moved to another room . He even asked our permission to move our luggage as he would take care of the room transfer while we were out enjoying our vacation. When we arrived back to the room late in the evening, we were told by the desk clerk that the manager told her to tell us that he had our original room thoroughly cleaned and inspected and the he wasn't going to move us and we can stay in the original room. At this point it became obvious that because we were pre-paid, they didn't care about out discontent. We insisted on being moved to another room and the desk clerk finally decided to help and get us moved. The next day, in our better room, my friend awoke to find a roach crawling across the nightstand. Since we were tired of moving, we stayed in this room and continued to arm ourselves with the can of roach spray. We didn't even bother to unpack our bags for fear that roaches would be running through our clothing and belongings. This is very inconvenient when lodging for an entire week. For the rest or our stay, it was one thing after another: a slow drain in the bathroom sink, wound up being a clogged drained, we saw ants in the room, the ice bucket was filthy, and surprisingly, we never saw an ice machine anywhere, (hmmm), I dropped a pair of shorts on the floor by mistake and the dust and dirt that was on my pants was INCREDIBLE, we dare not put our bare feet on the dirty ceramic floor for that reason, we constantly had to ask for extra towels, as they never left face cloths or an adequate amount of the thin bath towels in the room, parking was an issue as they were always surprisingly booked and had more cars than parking spaces, we often had to leave our car keys at the front desk so that the security guard could move our car, because we had to park and block someone in to get a half a space on the parking lot, the garbage receptacles were in plain view in the parking lot and every time you went to and from your vehicle, you smelled the stench of garbage and had to view it overflowing daily, most of the time when we returned to the hotel we had to walk threw a crowd of guests and hotel staff smoking and hanging out directly in front of the main entrance. Lastly, this place is so close to the airport that you constantly hear planes taking off. The planes fly so close that it sounds like they were often taking off on the roof of the hotel. It seemed like the staff at this hotel was used to these types of complaints and were not at all motivated to provide corrective action. Do yourself a favor and save yourself the frustration of trying to be budget conscious and don't stay at this hotel. I witnessed a number of people complaining and demanding a refund. I am a budget traveler by choice, and I have never experienced a 2 star hotel on this level. Heed the warning and save yourselves from "Horror By the Sea"

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!!!!”
Reviews.Author: loiza
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our trip to Puerto Rico. I booked a room at the Coral by the Sea Hotel and Restaurant because it was inexpensive. The day before my departure to Puerto Rico, I decided to read the reviews for the hotel(something that i normally do not do because I prefer to find things out myself). I began to freak out because of the negative reviews about this place and tried to look for rooms at other hotels within my "vacation budget". I finally came to the decision that we would not be in the room for long periods of time so we sucked it up and away we went. Coral by the Sea is not much to look at. The "free parking" is a total of 12 parking spots for all of the guests and staff. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The rooms are not much to look at either. A bed, a desk, 2 chairs, and a nightstand and the bathroom is extremely small. The A/C is very good however. The room was cleaned everyday of our stay (5 days) and we never had a problem. The hotel is located 2 blocks from the Isla Verde beach, 3 blocks from the El San Juan Hotel and Casino (which houses numerous nightclubs, restaurants and the aforementioned casino), within minutes of Old San Juan, and about 45 minutes from Luquillo Beach and El Yunque. With all of this going on around you, who actually wants to spend time in their hotel room? I truly believe that all the negative reviews are from people expecting a 5 star hotel at economy prices. For $80-$95 a night and with all the North and East side of Puerto Rico has to offer within an hour drive , the Coral by the Sea is an ideal spot to rest up from a long day of sightseeing and exploring. Does it has its flaws, sure it does, but the price, locale, and staff more than make up for it. Keep in mind that Coral by the Sea is a small, economy hotel and you will enjoy your stay. There is just so much to do in Puerto Rico than to worry about the quality of your hotel. Enjoy the restaurants, nightlife,casinoes, and shopping of the surrounding hotels and cities and then save some money and rest your head at Coral by the Sea

Reviews.Title: “Two Nights”
Reviews.Author: rhilla1
Reviews.Content: we stayed two nights at this hotel...one night on our way to culebra and then one night prior to our return...we booked this through travelocity...pros; convenient location, restaurants in hotel are excellent,staff very professional and helpful, cons; room 214 was dirty...no washcloths...we asked for another room ...we looked at fourth floor but we thought it was creepy...we stayed on second floor...room 212 had mold ...i was coughing from the minute i entered...when we left the room i didn't cough...i am not high maintenance but this was unacceptable...we went across to the hampton inn which was 139/night...but they had no room.... no i would not return....

Reviews.Title: “Would Have Slept on the Beach If I Had Known What We Were In For!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: So, me and a few friends decided to spend a night in Puerto Rico before leaving on our cruise, one of which we allowed to make the arrangements- We should have left him there. Never in my life have i stayed in such a pathetic dump. The place looked as if there should have been crows flying over and circling around it. One of my friends wouldn't let me open our door because becuase he was convinced he heard someone screaming and being murdered outside our room at some point in the night. The best was all of the raw chicken and half eaten food we found in the "fridge" , looked like we interupted some sacrificial ceremony of some sort- Please for you own sake DO NOT stay here- and, FYI, This is the first time in my life (31yo) i have ever been so impelled to post a review-

Reviews.Title: “You might get harrassed by the overnight girl(thumbs down)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 10 days were spent in this place. For one, I called the day before to make sure we could check in when we got there because we had a late flight coming in at 4 a.m. and I was told it would be ok. We get there and to our surprise the overnight guy not only didn't have our room ready and told us that we couldn't check in til 3 p.m, he also said that he didn't have me in the system as being registered as a guest. Luckily I brought my confirmation number of the website I booked it through or I would be up ----- creek. He gives us a room that someone already checked out of to get a few hours of sleep but we had to be out by 11 a.m. because if he got caught doing that he would be in trouble. Dude, i'm only 28, i'm not old enough to go telling on people so I took what I could get. Got outta there by 11 a.m.,stored out bags in the lobby and hit the streets til check in. Came back about 5 p.m. checked in our room. Don't stay in room 301 at the end of the hallway unless they changed the air conditioner. Even though it was new, that thing broke on us 3 days after we got there. I called the front desk and they changed us to room 317. Overall the place is inexpensive for the 10 days that we stayed. It's perfect for an older couple who wants to just walk to the casinos next door of just go to the denny's down the street. If your a young guy like me looking for a place to just slay women and go to to sleep for a few hours and do it all over again,this is not the place for you. You need to go either to condado or old san juan and that's where all the women are. Spend the extra money and stay at a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price and location you can't do better. The staff is very friendly, you are 30 seconds away from the beach on foot, and 30 seconds away from buses to the airport or old San Juan. Isla Verde (where the hotel is) is a safe touristy place but, of course, old San Juan is far more picturesque -- and far more expensive... Make sure to eat at PLATOS, the hotel's restaurant: some of the best food I had in Puerto Rico and, again, very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Mom and Pop place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a trip to Puerto Rico. We stayed at the Coral by the Sea hotel. My husband and I enjoyed our stay there. If you're looking for a hotel that has Ralph Lauren towels, grand chandeliers, Monet paintings on the wall, hair blower and an ocean view do not stay at this hotel. But If like us, you just want a clean room with fresh towels, mini soaps, a color TV and air conditioner for a reasonable price, this is the place for you. There is free parking for your car rental and a restaurant right in the building. The beach, stores and other restaurants are within walking distance. Casinos with entertainment are in the same local area. It is in a nice neighborhood to take a walk in the evening. The hotel has a friendly staff and are truly helpful. Will I go there again? I'm already planning my trip for next year. A&J

Reviews.Title: “Coral in thge DUMP”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Terrible. They charged us 100 dollars a nite. It's a freaking dump and we are not exagerating. We thought we were saving money but u have to spen d money onshampoo, soap, water, extra towels and no complimentary breakfast. Spend 30 dollars more and be happier. I wonder where all the money in that hotel goes???? Do not stay in Isla verde, stay at El COndado.o old san juan.... beautiful

Reviews.Title: “Most disgusting, unhealthy place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip knowing we were on budget. We have stayed at motels, hostels before.When we got there, we had to wait for 30 min to check in because guys were changing shifts. Ceiling was leaking. OK, so we finally checked in and got the key to the room. We opned the door, ans froze. Sand, food, water bottle on the floor from the previous guests, no sheets on bed, flies flying around in the room, no AC. We didn't even peek into the bathroom. We called the website we reserved our trip with and walked across to a hotel suite which was 2X more than what we could afford, but thank God, my credit card wasnt maxed out, otherwise we would have been on the street. They told us that we were not the first one coming to the hotel for assistance from coral by the sea. We are home, waiting for paperwork to go thru for our refund. Doesnt Puerto Rico have some type of health code? Parking lot at hotel suites was a lot cleaner than coral by the sea. Unfortunate because Puerto Rico was beautiful and people were very very nice EXCEPT coral by the sea. I can not believe they have guts to charge people?!! I would not stay even it was for free. I wish I took a picture of it so I could show it to the world. I am really surprised that they are standing and charging people. $8.00 hostels in Hawaii was MUCH MUCH CLEANER than coral by the sea.

Reviews.Title: “A little third world, but just a little!”
Reviews.Author: JimGreen
Reviews.Content: I travel as a senior,single male and am a value shopper,(i.e. The Mayfair Hotel 249 W49st NYC). For $62.00 a night, nothing was going to suprise me. The TV (era 1980) worked, small bathroom (size: 4 NYC phone booths) Plenty of hot water, small towels, clean sheets, courteous, helpfull front desk staff. My room had a remote control for the window A/C. Worked great! I was there to sleep only. Nice 24 hour restraunt off one side of lobby, from the other side of lobby a bar. Off street parking behind hotel. 300 yds from beach, 50 yards from a internet cafe. Felt safe walking at night. Many restraunts within walking distance, casino at El San Juan 400 yds. Was told the airport was 5 minutes away, really was 9 mins. Would I stay there again...Yes

HotelInfo.Name: Coral by the Sea Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Rosa 2, Isla Verde 00979, Puerto Rico
